intro: Viola erecta, commonly known as the upright violet, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring upright stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, violet-colored flowers with five petals, often marked with yellow or white markings. Viola erecta thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. It is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
